comments:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Download the Eclipse 3.1M5a SDK from:
http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/eclipse/downloads/drops/S-3.1M5a-200502191500/eclipse-SDK-3.1M5a-win32.zip

2. Downloaded the CDT 3.0 build from:
http://download.eclipse.org/tools/cdt/builds/3.0.0/I.I200503170300/org.eclipse.cdt.sdk-3.0.0-I200503170300-win32.x86.zip

3. Create a "Standard Make C++ Project" named "test".

4. Add hello.cpp and makefile on that project. hello.cpp and makefile can be
found at
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/cdt-home/user/faq.html?cvsroot=Tools_Project#create_10

5. Create make target "all".

6. Build make target "all".

7. The binary file "hello.exe" is created. (Using Cygwin compiler/linker).

8. Create a new "C/C++ Local Application" debug configuration.

9. Choose project as "test".

10. Press button "Search" for "C/C++ Application". "hello.exe" is NOT listed there.

11. Type "hello.exe" in the "C/C++ Application" text box.

12. Press "Apply" and "Debug".

13. Following exception is thrown:

java.io.FileNotFoundException: Program not Binary
at
org.eclipse.cdt.launch.AbstractCLaunchDelegate.verifyBinary(AbstractCLaunchDelegate.java:747)
at
org.eclipse.cdt.launch.internal.LocalRunLaunchDelegate.launch(LocalRunLaunchDelegate.java:59)
at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:590)
at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:515)
at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:795)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:993)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

You have to choose the right binary parser.

Go in the project property choose
Make project --> and in the tab Binary Parser
choose :
"PE binary parser"
or
"Cygwin PE binary parser"

Cygwin PE binary parser works.

thanks,
sumit
